Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intraoperative Molecular Imaging in Pulmonary Resection for Lung Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: patients with lung nodules were randomised

Participants.evidence: eligibility criteria including patients with suspected lung adenocarcinomas. The trial was set across various institutions

Intervention.evidence: patients with lung nodules were randomised to receive OTL38 (0.025mg/kg) preoperatively

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the impact of intraoperative molecular imaging (IMI) using OTL38

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the occurrence of clinically significant events (CSE)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: patients with lung nodules were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: IMI identified 24 additional nodules, 9 of which were occult cancers

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events were reported
